Detailed Description

Class responsible for processing MCMC chains, performing diagnostics, generating plots, and managing Bayesian analysis.

This class provides utilities to handle MCMC output generated by mcmc::runMCMC. It is particularly useful for extracting values from previous MCMC runs and initiating new MCMC runs with those values. Inspired by nd280_utils/DrawComp.cpp.

See also
For more details and examples, visit the Wiki.

)

KS: calc Effective Sample Size.

Parameters
nLagsShould be the same nLags as used in AutoCorrelation()

This function computes the Effective Sample Size (ESS) using the autocorrelations calculated by AutoCorrelation(). Ensure that the parameter nLags here matches the number of lags used in AutoCorrelation() to obtain accurate results. [StanManual] [hanson2008mcmc] [gabry2024visual]

3818 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i] = new TH1D(Form("EffectiveSampleSizeHist_%i",i), Form("EffectiveSampleSizeHist_%i",i), nDraw, 0, nDraw);
3819 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("N_{eff}/N");
3820 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->SetFillColor(ESSColours[i]);
3821 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->SetLineColor(ESSColours[i]);
3822 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->Sumw2();
3823 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
3824 {
3825 TString Title = "";
3826 double Prior = 1.0;
3827 double PriorError = 1.0;
3828 GetNthParameter(j, Prior, PriorError, Title);
3829 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->GetXaxis()->SetBinLabel(j+1, Title.Data());
3830 }
3831 }
3832
3833 #ifdef MULTITHREAD
3834 #pragma omp parallel for
3835 #endif
3836 //KS: Calculate ESS and MCMC efficiency for each parameter
3837 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
3838 {
3839 (*EffectiveSampleSize)(j) = _UNDEF_;
3840 (*SamplingEfficiency)(j) = _UNDEF_;
3841 TempDenominator[j] = 0.;
3842 //KS: Firs sum over all Calculated autocorrelations
3843 for (int k = 0; k < nLags; ++k)
3844 {
3845 TempDenominator[j] += LagL[j][k];
3846 }
3847 TempDenominator[j] = 1+2*TempDenominator[j];
3848 (*EffectiveSampleSize)(j) = nEntries/TempDenominator[j];
3849 // 100 because we convert to percentage
3850 (*SamplingEfficiency)(j) = 100 * 1/TempDenominator[j];
3851
3852 for(int i = 0; i < Nhists; ++i)
3853 {
3854 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->SetBinContent(j+1, 0);
3855 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->SetBinError(j+1, 0);
3856
3857 const double TempEntry = std::fabs((*EffectiveSampleSize)(j)) / nEntries;
3858 if(Thresholds[i] >= TempEntry && TempEntry > Thresholds[i+1])
3859 {
3860 if( std::isnan((*EffectiveSampleSize)(j)) ) continue;
3861 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->SetBinContent(j+1, TempEntry);
3862 }
3863 }
3864 }
3865
3866 //KS Write to the output tree
3867 //Save to file
3868 OutputFile->cd();
3869 EffectiveSampleSize->Write("EffectiveSampleSize");
3870 SamplingEfficiency->Write("SamplingEfficiency");
3871
3872 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[0]->SetTitle("Effective Sample Size");
3873 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[0]->Draw();
3874 for(int i = 1; i < Nhists; ++i)
3875 {
3876 EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i]->Draw("SAME");
3877 }
3878
3879 TLegend *leg = new TLegend(0.2, 0.7, 0.6, 0.95);
3880 leg->SetTextSize(0.03);
3881 for(int i = 0; i < Nhists; ++i)
3882 {
3883 leg->AddEntry(EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i], Form("%.4f >= N_{eff}/N > %.4f", Thresholds[i], Thresholds[i+1]), "f");
3884 }
3885 leg->SetLineColor(0);
3886 leg->SetLineStyle(0);
3887 leg->SetFillColor(0);
3888 leg->SetFillStyle(0);
3889 leg->Draw("SAME");
3890
3891 Posterior->Write("EffectiveSampleSizeCanvas");
3892
3893 //Delete all variables
3894 delete EffectiveSampleSize;
3895 delete SamplingEfficiency;
3896 for(int i = 0; i < Nhists; ++i)
3897 {
3898 delete EffectiveSampleSizeHist[i];
3899 }

Calculate Bayes factor for vector of params, and model boundaries.

Parameters
ParNameVector with parameter names for which we calculate Bayes factor
Model1BoundsLower and upper bound for hypothesis 1. Within this bound we calculate integral used later for Bayes Factor
Model2BoundsLower and upper bound for hypothesis 2. Within this bound we calculate integral used later for Bayes Factor
ModelNamesNames for hypothesis 1 and 2

2992 MACH3LOG_ERROR("Lower bound is higher than upper bound");
2993 throw MaCh3Exception(__FILE__ , __LINE__ );
2994 }
2995 PriorHist = new TH1D("PriorHist", Title, NBins, Bounds[k][0], Bounds[k][1]);
2996
2997 double FlatProb = ( Bounds[k][1] - Bounds[k][0]) / NBins;
2998 for (int g = 0; g < NBins + 1; ++g)
2999 {
3000 PriorHist->SetBinContent(g+1, FlatProb);
3001 }
3002 }
3003 else //KS: Otherwise throw from Gaussian
3004 {
3005 PriorHist = (TH1D*) PosteriorHist->Clone("Prior");
3006 PriorHist->Reset("");
3007 PriorHist->Fill(0.0, 0.0);
3008
3009 TRandom3* rand = new TRandom3(0);
3010 //KS: Throw nice gaussian, just need big number to have smooth distribution
3011 for(int g = 0; g < 1000000; ++g)
3012 {
3013 PriorHist->Fill(rand->Gaus(Prior, PriorError));
3014 }
3015 delete rand;
3016 }
3017 // Area normalise the distributions
3018 PriorHist->Scale(1./PriorHist->Integral(), "width");
3019 PosteriorHist->Scale(1./PosteriorHist->Integral(), "width");
3020
3021 PriorHist->SetLineColor(kRed);
3022 PriorHist->SetMarkerColor(kRed);
3023 PriorHist->SetFillColorAlpha(kRed, 0.35);
3024 PriorHist->SetFillStyle(1001);
3025 PriorHist->GetXaxis()->SetTitle(Title);
3026 PriorHist->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("Posterior Probability");
3027 PriorHist->SetMaximum(PosteriorHist->GetMaximum()*1.5);
3028 PriorHist->GetYaxis()->SetLabelOffset(999);
3029 PriorHist->GetYaxis()->SetLabelSize(0);
3030 PriorHist->SetLineWidth(2);
3031 PriorHist->SetLineStyle(kSolid);
3032
3033 PosteriorHist->SetLineColor(kBlue);
3034 PosteriorHist->SetMarkerColor(kBlue);
3035 PosteriorHist->SetFillColorAlpha(kBlue, 0.35);
3036 PosteriorHist->SetFillStyle(1001);
3037
3038 PriorHist->Draw("hist");
3039 PosteriorHist->Draw("hist same");
3040
3041 double ProbPrior = PriorHist->GetBinContent(PriorHist->FindBin(EvaluationPoint[k]));
3042 //KS: In case we go so far away that prior is 0, set this to small value to avoid dividing by 0
3043 if(ProbPrior < 0) ProbPrior = 0.00001;
3044 double ProbPosterior = PosteriorHist->GetBinContent(PosteriorHist->FindBin(EvaluationPoint[k]));
3045 double SavageDickey = ProbPosterior/ProbPrior;
3046
3047 std::string DunneKabothScale = GetDunneKaboth(SavageDickey);
3048 //Get Best point
3049 TGraph *PostPoint = new TGraph(1);
3050 PostPoint->SetPoint(0, EvaluationPoint[k], ProbPosterior);
3051 PostPoint->SetMarkerStyle(20);
3052 PostPoint->SetMarkerSize(1);
3053 PostPoint->Draw("P same");
3054
3055 TGraph *PriorPoint = new TGraph(1);
3056 PriorPoint->SetPoint(0, EvaluationPoint[k], ProbPrior);
3057 PriorPoint->SetMarkerStyle(20);
3058 PriorPoint->SetMarkerSize(1);
3059 PriorPoint->Draw("P same");
3060
3061 TLegend *legend = new TLegend(0.12, 0.6, 0.6, 0.97);
3062 legend->SetTextSize(0.04);
3063 legend->AddEntry(PriorHist, "Prior", "l");
3064 legend->AddEntry(PosteriorHist, "Posterior", "l");
3065 legend->AddEntry(PostPoint, Form("SavageDickey = %.2f, (%s)", SavageDickey, DunneKabothScale.c_str()),"");
3066 legend->SetLineColor(0);
3067 legend->SetLineStyle(0);
3068 legend->SetFillColor(0);
3069 legend->SetFillStyle(0);
3070 legend->SetBorderSize(0);
3071 legend->Draw("same");
3072
3073 Posterior->Print(CanvasName);
3074 Posterior->Write(Title);
3075
3076 delete PosteriorHist;
3077 delete PriorHist;
3078 delete PostPoint;
3079 delete PriorPoint;
3080 delete legend;
3081 } //End loop over parameters
3082
3083 SavageDickeyDir->Close();
3084 delete SavageDickeyDir;
3085
3086 OutputFile->cd();
3087}

void MCMCProcessor::GewekeDiagnostic ( )

Geweke Diagnostic based on the methods described by Fang (2014) and Karlsbakk (2011). [Fang2014GewekeDiagnostics] [karlsbakk2011].

4218 {
4219// **************************
4220 MACH3LOG_INFO("Making Geweke Diagnostic");
4221
4222 //KS: Up refers to upper limit we check, it stays constant, in literature it is mostly 50% thus using 0.5 for threshold
4223 double* MeanUp = new double[nDraw]();
4224 double* SpectralVarianceUp = new double[nDraw]();
4225 int* DenomCounterUp = new int[nDraw]();
4226 const double Threshold = 0.5 * nSteps;
4227
4228 //KS: Select values between which you want to scan, for example 0 means 0% burn in and 1 100% burn in.
4229 constexpr double LowerThreshold = 0;
4230 constexpr double UpperThreshold = 1.0;
4231 // Tells how many intervals between thresholds we want to check
4232 constexpr int NChecks = 100;
4233 constexpr double Division = (UpperThreshold - LowerThreshold)/NChecks;
4234
4235 TH1D** GewekePlots = new TH1D*[nDraw];
4236 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4237 {
4238 MeanUp[j] = 0;
4239 SpectralVarianceUp[j] = 0;
4240 DenomCounterUp[j] = 0;
4241
4242 TString Title = "";
4243 double Prior = 1.0;
4244 double PriorError = 1.0;
4245 GetNthParameter(j, Prior, PriorError, Title);
4246 std::string HistName = Form("%s_%s_Geweke", Title.Data(), BranchNames[j].Data());
4247 GewekePlots[j] = new TH1D(HistName.c_str(), HistName.c_str(), NChecks, 0.0, 100*UpperThreshold);
4248 GewekePlots[j]->GetXaxis()->SetTitle("Burn-In (%)");
4249 GewekePlots[j]->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("Geweke T score");
4250 }
4251
4252//KS: Start parallel region
4253#ifdef MULTITHREAD
4254#pragma omp parallel
4255{
4256#endif
4257 //KS: First we calculate mean and spectral variance for the upper limit, this doesn't change and in literature is most often 50%
4258 #ifdef MULTITHREAD
4259 #pragma omp for
4260 #endif
4261 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4262 {
4263 for(int i = 0; i < nEntries; ++i)
4264 {
4265 if(StepNumber[i] > Threshold)
4266 {
4267 MeanUp[j] += ParStep[j][i];
4268 DenomCounterUp[j]++;
4269 }
4270 }
4271 MeanUp[j] = MeanUp[j]/DenomCounterUp[j];
4272 }
4273
4274 //KS: now Spectral variance which in this case is sample variance
4275 #ifdef MULTITHREAD
4276 #pragma omp for collapse(2)
4277 #endif
4278 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4279 {
4280 for(int i = 0; i < nEntries; ++i)
4281 {
4282 if(StepNumber[i] > Threshold)
4283 {
4284 SpectralVarianceUp[j] += (ParStep[j][i] - MeanUp[j])*(ParStep[j][i] - MeanUp[j]);
4285 }
4286 }
4287 }
4288
4289 //Loop over how many intervals we calculate
4290 #ifdef MULTITHREAD
4291 #pragma omp for
4292 #endif
4293 for (int k = 1; k < NChecks+1; ++k)
4294 {
4295 //KS each thread has it's own
4296 double* MeanDown = new double[nDraw]();
4297 double* SpectralVarianceDown = new double[nDraw]();
4298 int* DenomCounterDown = new int[nDraw]();
4299
4300 //set to 0
4301 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4302 {
4303 MeanDown[j] = 0;
4304 SpectralVarianceDown[j] = 0;
4305 DenomCounterDown[j] = 0;
4306 }
4307
4308 const int ThresholsCheck = Division*k*nSteps;
4309 //KS: First mean
4310 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4311 {
4312 for(int i = 0; i < nEntries; ++i)
4313 {
4314 if(StepNumber[i] < ThresholsCheck)
4315 {
4316 MeanDown[j] += ParStep[j][i];
4317 DenomCounterDown[j]++;
4318 }
4319 }
4320 MeanDown[j] = MeanDown[j]/DenomCounterDown[j];
4321 }
4322
4323 //Now spectral variance
4324 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4325 {
4326 for(int i = 0; i < nEntries; ++i)
4327 {
4328 if(StepNumber[i] < ThresholsCheck)
4329 {
4330 SpectralVarianceDown[j] += (ParStep[j][i] - MeanDown[j])*(ParStep[j][i] - MeanDown[j]);
4331 }
4332 }
4333 }
4334 //Lastly calc T score and fill histogram entry
4335 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4336 {
4337 double T_score = std::fabs((MeanDown[j] - MeanUp[j])/std::sqrt(SpectralVarianceDown[j]/DenomCounterDown[j] + SpectralVarianceUp[j]/DenomCounterUp[j]));
4338
4339 GewekePlots[j]->SetBinContent(k, T_score);
4340 }
4341 //KS: delete for each thread
4342 delete[] MeanDown;
4343 delete[] SpectralVarianceDown;
4344 delete[] DenomCounterDown;
4345 } //end loop over intervals
4346#ifdef MULTITHREAD
4347} //End parallel region
4348#endif
4349
4350 //Finally save it to TFile
4351 OutputFile->cd();
4352 TDirectory *GewekeDir = OutputFile->mkdir("Geweke");
4353 for (int j = 0; j < nDraw; ++j)
4354 {
4355 GewekeDir->cd();
4356 GewekePlots[j]->Write();
4357 delete GewekePlots[j];
4358 }
4359 delete[] GewekePlots;
4360
4361 //Free memory
4362 delete[] MeanUp;
4363 delete[] DenomCounterUp;
4364 delete[] SpectralVarianceUp;
4365
4366 for (int i = 0; i < nDraw; ++i) {
4367 delete[] ParStep[i];
4368 }
4369 delete[] ParStep;
4370
4371 GewekeDir->Close();
4372 delete GewekeDir;
4373
4374 OutputFile->cd();
4375}

1361 SubOptimality->GetYaxis()->SetTitle("Suboptimality");
1362 SubOptimality->SetLineWidth(2);
1363 SubOptimality->SetLineColor(kBlue);
1364
1365 for(int i = 0; i < NIntervals; ++i)
1366 {
1367 //Reset our cov matrix
1368 ResetHistograms();
1369
1370 //Set threshold for calculating new matrix
1371 UpperCut = i*IntervalsSize;
1372 //Calculate cov matrix
1373 MakeCovariance_MP(true);
1374
1375 //Calculate eigen values
1376 TMatrixDSymEigen eigen(*Covariance);
1377 TVectorD eigen_values;
1378 eigen_values.ResizeTo(eigen.GetEigenValues());
1379 eigen_values = eigen.GetEigenValues();
1380
1381 //KS: Converting from ROOT to vector as to make using other libraires (Eigen) easier in future
1382 std::vector<double> EigenValues(eigen_values.GetNrows());
1383 for(unsigned int j = 0; j < EigenValues.size(); j++)
1384 {
1385 EigenValues[j] = eigen_values(j);
1386 }
1387 const double SubOptimalityValue = GetSubOptimality(EigenValues, nDraw);
1388 SubOptimality->SetBinContent(i+1, SubOptimalityValue);
1389 }
1390 clock.Stop();
1391 MACH3LOG_INFO("Making Suboptimality took {:.2f}s to finish for {} steps", clock.RealTime(), nEntries);
1392
1393 UpperCut = DefaultUpperCut;
1394 BurnInCut = DefaultBurnInCut;
1395 printToPDF = defaultPrintToPDF;
1396
1397 SubOptimality->Draw("l");
1398 Posterior->SetName(SubOptimality->GetName());
1399 Posterior->SetTitle(SubOptimality->GetTitle());
1400
1401 if(printToPDF) Posterior->Print(CanvasName);
1402 // Write it to root file
1403 OutputFile->cd();
1404 Posterior->Write();
1405
1406 delete SubOptimality;
1407}

)

Make fancy triangle plot for selected parameters.

Parameters
CredibleIntervalsVector with values of credible intervals, must be in descending order
CredibleIntervalsColoursColor_t telling what colour to use for each Interval line
CredibleInSigmasBool telling whether intervals are in percentage or in sigmas, then special conversions is used
CredibleRegionsVector with values of credible intervals, must be in descending order
CredibleRegionStyleStyle_t telling what line style to use for each Interval line
CredibleRegionColorColor_t telling what colour to use for each Interval line
CredibleInSigmasBool telling whether intervals are in percentage or in sigmas, then special conversions is used

Scale the histograms so it shows the posterior probability
